text.div:
ResearchStudy Logical Model

A clinical trial or similar research study. Reference: list of FDA data elements describing a research study: prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html

name: ResearchStudy
title: obf-ResearchStudy
description: A clinical trial or similar research study. Reference: list of FDA data elements describing a research study: prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html

element.definition: A clinical trial or similar research study. Reference: list of FDA data elements describing a research study: prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html

element.short: Elements that belong to all information items.
element.definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

element.short: A human language, spoken or written.
element.definition: A human language, spoken or written.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

element.short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
element.definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

element.short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
element.definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

element.short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
element.definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

element.short: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.
element.definition: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.

element.short: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.
element.definition: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

element.short: Description of the intent or use of the item.
element.definition: Description of the intent or use of the item.

element.short: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.
element.definition: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

element.short: The general type or class of this item.
element.definition: The general type or class of this item.

element.short: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).
element.definition: The person or entity that the information in this resource relates to, if different than the person of record. The subject of information can be a reference or a code, the latter when the subject is described generically, for example, in terms of a relationship to the subject of record (e.g., wife).

element.short: The condition that is the focus of the study. For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion 'healthy volunteer', but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code.
element.definition: The condition that is the focus of the study. For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion 'healthy volunteer', but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code.

element.short: Describes an individual and how to reach them.
element.definition: Describes an individual and how to reach them.

element.short: Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.
element.definition: Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.

element.short: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.
element.definition: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.

element.short: The country, state or other region taking legal responsibility.
element.definition: The country, state or other region taking legal responsibility.

element.short: A description of the purpose of the item.
element.definition: A description of the purpose of the item.

element.short: Description of the group or groups enrolled or qualified to be enrolled in the study.
element.definition: Description of the group or groups enrolled or qualified to be enrolled in the study.

element.short: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.
element.definition: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.

element.short: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.
element.definition: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.

element.short: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.
element.definition: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.

element.short: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.
element.definition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.

element.short: A code explaining unplanned or premature termination of a plan of treatment, course of medication, or research study.
element.definition: A code explaining unplanned or premature termination of a plan of treatment, course of medication, or research study.

element.short: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.
element.definition: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.

element.short: Arm refers to pre-specified group or subgroup of participant(s) in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.
element.definition: Arm refers to pre-specified group or subgroup of participant(s) in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.

element.short: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
element.definition: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
